attributes.action: Modify the parliamentary calender to allow for debate of popular petitions
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The 2000 European Convention lays the groundwork for member state legislatures to be petitioned by citizens for legislation. Something to which former Cabinet Secretary Sir Richard Wilson alluded to in several of his speeches.
As a leading member of the Union, I believe that the British Government should lead by example in this field and  allow time in the Parliamentary calender for free debate on issues highlighted by popular petitions to the P.M.O, along with the current allowance for Private members' Bills.
